get_connections.description: Get a list of available connections based on the specified role.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: The role to get connections for, either "client" or "agent". List[ConnectionModel]: A list of connection models for the specified role.

prompt.description: Send a prompt to the AI and get a response.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The prompt(s) to send to the AI model.

parameters.name: instructions
parameters.description: Additional instructions for the AI. Defaults to [].

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: The expected format for the AI response. Defaults to None.

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: Controls randomness in the AI response, from 0.0 to 2.0. Defaults to 1.0. The AI response formatted according to the specified format if provided. ValueError: If temperature is not between 0.0 and 2.0.

get_persistent_dir.description: Get the path to the persistent directory Returns: pathlib.Path: Path to the persistent directory

get_project_url.description: Get the project URL. localhost if running locally Returns: str: Project URL

get_public_dir.description: Get the path to the public directory Returns: pathlib.Path: Path to the public directory

create_public_link.description: Create a public link for a file by copying it to the public directory

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the file str: Public link to the file

get_execution_id.description: Get the execution ID of the current execution.

use_legacy_threads.description: Sets up compatibility mode for legacy threading functionality.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: The execution mode for the legacy threads.

get_access_token.description: Retrieve an access token by its name.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the access token to retrieve. AccessTokenDTO: The access token data transfer object.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the Google Sheets connection. Defaults to "google-sheets". AbstraGoogleCredentials: Credentials object for Google Sheets authentication.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the Google Drive connection. Defaults to "google-drive". AbstraGoogleCredentials: Credentials object for Google Drive authentication.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the Gmail connection. Defaults to "gmail". AbstraGoogleCredentials: Credentials object for Gmail authentication.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the BigQuery connection. Defaults to "google-bigquery". AbstraGoogleCredentials: Credentials object for Google BigQuery authentication.

parameters.name: connection_name
parameters.description: The name of the Google Calendar connection. Defaults to "google-calendar". AbstraGoogleCredentials: Credentials object for Google Calendar authentication.

create_public_link.description: Create a public link for a file by copying it to the public directory

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the file str: Public link to the file

get_persistent_dir.description: Get the path to the persistent directory Returns: pathlib.Path: Path to the persistent directory

get_public_dir.description: Get the path to the public directory Returns: pathlib.Path: Path to the public directory

execute_js.description: Execute JavaScript code in the browser

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: JavaScript code to execute

parameters.name: context
parameters.description: Context to pass to the JavaScript code. Defaults to {}. Any: Result of the JavaScript code

get_query_params.description: Get the query parameters from the current URL Returns: Dict[str, str]: Query parameters

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: Whether to force refresh the user. Defaults to False. Union[UserClaims, None]: User information

redirect.description: Redirect the user to a new URL

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL to redirect to

parameters.name: query_params
parameters.description: Query parameters to append to the URL. Defaults to None. None

reuse.description: Reuse the result of a function call with the given arguments.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: The function to reuse.

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: Variable length argument list to pass to the function.

parameters.name: kwargs
parameters.description: Arbitrary keyword arguments to pass to the function. Any: The result of the function call.

Button.description: Base class for form navigation buttons.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: The text displayed on the button.

NextButton.description: Button used to navigate to the next step in a form. Automatically labeled with internationalized "Next" text.

BackButton.description: Button used to navigate to the previous step in a form. Automatically labeled with internationalized "Back" text.

ListItemSchema.description: A schema for a list item This schema is used to define the schema of a list item.

AppointmentInput.description: Appointment scheduling input widget for selecting time slots.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Text label displayed above the input.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Identifier for the widget, defaults to label if not provided.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Whether a time slot must be selected before proceeding.

parameters.name: hint
parameters.description: Help text displayed below the input.

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: Whether the input should take up the full width of its container.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the input is non-interactive.

parameters.name: slots
parameters.description: List of available time slots.

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: Pre-defined validation error messages to display.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description: The total value representing 100% progress.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text displayed alongside the progress bar.

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: Whether the progress bar should take up the full width of its container.

RatingInput.description: Rating input widget for capturing user ratings on a scale.

parameters.name: label
parameters.description: Text label displayed above the input.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Identifier for the widget, defaults to label if not provided.

parameters.name: required
parameters.description: Whether a rating must be selected before proceeding.

parameters.name: hint
parameters.description: Help text displayed below the input.

parameters.name: full_width
parameters.description: Whether the input should take up the full width of its container.

parameters.name: disabled
parameters.description: Whether the input is non-interactive.

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: Pre-defined validation error messages to display.

parameters.name: max_value
parameters.description: Maximum value for the rating scale.

parameters.name: multiple

parameters.description: Minimum number of files required when multiple=True.

parameters.name: accepted_formats
parameters.description: List of accepted file extensions.

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: Pre-defined validation error messages to display.

run.description: Run a form with the given runnables or a single widget. This is the main entry point for executing forms. It supports two modes: 1. Running a list of runnables as a multi-step form 2. Running a single widget to get its value

parameters.name: runnables
parameters.description: Either a list of form steps or a single widget.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Initial state values for the form.

parameters.name: hide_steps
parameters.description: Whether to hide steps navigation in the UI. Union[State, None, object]: - For a list of runnables: the final State object - For a single InputWidget: the widget's value - For other single widgets: None

end_page_step.description: Decorator that converts a function into an EndPageStep.

parameters.name: func
parameters.description: The function to be decorated. EndPageStep: A step object that represents the end page of a form.

get_raw_request.description: Get the raw HTTP request data. Returns: Tuple[str, Dict[str, str], Dict[str, str]]: A tuple containing: - Raw request body as a string - Request headers as a dictionary - Request query parameters as a dictionary

get_request.description: Get the HTTP request data with parsed body. Returns: Tuple[Union[str, List, Dict], Dict[str, str], Dict[str, str]]: A tuple containing: - Parsed request body (as string, list, or dict depending on content type) - Request headers as a dictionary - Request query parameters as a dictionary

signature.return_annotation: typing.Tuple[typing.Union[str, typing.List, typing.Dict], typing.Dict[str, str], typing.Dict[str, str]]

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Response body content. Non-string values will be serialized to JSON. Defaults to empty string.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: HTTP status code. Defaults to 200.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP response headers. Defaults to empty dict. BadSendResponse: If status_code is not an integer or headers is not a dictionary.

send_json.description: Send a JSON HTTP response. Automatically sets the Content-Type header to application/json if not already set.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data to be serialized to JSON. Defaults to empty dict.

parameters.name: status_code
parameters.description: HTTP status code. Defaults to 200.

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: HTTP response headers. Defaults to empty dict. BadSendResponse: If status_code is not an integer or headers is not a dictionary.

get_email_request.description: Get the raw email request data. Returns: dict: Email request data containing sender, recipients, subject, and body information.

send_email.description: Send an email to one or more recipients.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: Email address(es) of the recipient(s). Can be a single email address as a string or multiple addresses as a list of strings.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: Content of the email message.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Subject line of the email. Defaults to "".

parameters.name: attachments
parameters.description: List of attachments to include. Each attachment can be a file path string or an open file-like object. Defaults to [].

parameters.name: is_html
parameters.description: Whether the message content is HTML. When True, the message will be sent as HTML; when False, the message will be sent as plain text. Defaults to False.

run.description: Execute a raw SQL query with parameters (deprecated, use run_sql instead).

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: SQL query to execute.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: List of parameters for the query. Defaults to []. List[dict]: List of rows returned by the query.

run_sql.description: Execute a raw SQL query with parameters.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: SQL query to execute.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: List of parameters for the query. Defaults to []. List[dict]: List of rows returned by the query.

query_df.description: Execute a raw SQL query and return the results as a pandas DataFrame.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: SQL query to execute.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: List of parameters for the query. Defaults to []. pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing the query results.

TablesExecutionError.description: Exception raised when there is an error executing a SQL query.

parameters.name: errors
parameters.description: List of error messages from the database.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: The SQL query that caused the error.

parameters.name: params
parameters.description: The parameters used in the query.

select.description: Select rows from a table with filtering and ordering options.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to select from.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of conditions for the WHERE clause.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Column name to order by.

parameters.name: order_desc
parameters.description: Whether to order in descending order. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of rows to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of rows to skip. List[dict]: List of rows matching the query.

select_by_id.description: Select a single row from a table by its ID.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to select from.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the row to select. Optional[dict]: The matching row, or None if no row matches.

select_df.description: Select rows from a table and return a pandas DataFrame.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to select from.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of conditions for the WHERE clause.

parameters.name: order_by
parameters.description: Column name to order by.

parameters.name: order_desc
parameters.description: Whether to order in descending order. Defaults to False.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of rows to return.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of rows to skip. pandas.DataFrame: DataFrame containing the rows matching the query.

select_one.description: Select a single row from a table.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to select from.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of conditions for the WHERE clause. Optional[dict]: The first matching row, or None if no rows match.

insert.description: Insert one or more rows into a table.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to insert into.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Dictionary of column-value pairs for a single row, or list of dictionaries for multiple rows. Union[dict, List[dict]]: The inserted row if values is a dict, or a list of all inserted rows if values is a list.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to update.

parameters.name: set
parameters.description: Dictionary (or dataclass) of column-value pairs to set.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary (or dataclass) of column-value pairs for the WHERE clause. List[dict]: List of updated rows.

delete.description: Delete rows from a table based on conditions.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to delete from.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Dictionary (or dataclass) of column-value pairs for the WHERE clause. List[dict]: List of deleted rows.

update_by_id.description: Update a row in a table by its ID.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to update.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the row to update.

parameters.name: values
parameters.description: Dictionary (or dataclass) of column-value pairs to set. Optional[dict]: The updated row, or None if no row matches.

delete_by_id.description: Delete a row from a table by its ID.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Name of the table to delete from.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of the row to delete. Optional[dict]: The deleted row, or None if no row matches.

is_eq.description: Comparator for SQL equality operator (=). Checks if a column value equals a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_neq.description: Comparator for SQL inequality operator (<>). Checks if a column value is not equal to a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_gt.description: Comparator for SQL greater than operator (>). Checks if a column value is greater than a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_between.description: Comparator for SQL BETWEEN operator. Checks if a column value is between two specified values (inclusive).

parameters.name: value1
parameters.description: The lower bound value.

parameters.name: value2
parameters.description: The upper bound value.

is_gte.description: Comparator for SQL greater than or equal operator (>=). Checks if a column value is greater than or equal to a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_in.description: Comparator for SQL IN operator. Checks if a column value is in a specified list of values.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The list of values to check against.

is_lt.description: Comparator for SQL less than operator (<). Checks if a column value is less than a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_like.description: Comparator for SQL LIKE operator. Checks if a column value matches a pattern (case-sensitive).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The pattern to match against.

is_lte.description: Comparator for SQL less than or equal operator (<=). Checks if a column value is less than or equal to a specified value.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The value to compare against.

is_not_in.description: Comparator for SQL NOT IN operator. Checks if a column value is not in a specified list of values.

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The list of values to check against.

is_not_like.description: Comparator for SQL NOT LIKE operator. Checks if a column value does not match a pattern (case-sensitive).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The pattern to match against.

is_null.description: Comparator for SQL 'IS NULL' operator. Checks if a column value is NULL.

is_not_null.description: Comparator for SQL IS NOT NULL operator. Checks if a column value is not NULL.

is_ilike.description: Comparator for SQL ILIKE operator. Checks if a column value matches a pattern (case-insensitive).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The pattern to match against.

is_not_ilike.description: Comparator for SQL NOT ILIKE operator. Checks if a column value does not match a pattern (case-insensitive).

parameters.name: value
parameters.description: The pattern to match against.

get_tasks.description: Retrieve a list of pending tasks.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to retrieve. Defaults to None which is interpreted as 100. Will be capped at 10000.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of tasks to skip. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of filters to apply. Defaults to None. List[Task]: List of pending tasks matching the criteria.

send_task.description: Send a new task to the task queue.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Type identifier for the task.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: Dictionary containing the task data.

parameters.name: show_warning
parameters.description: Whether to show warnings. Defaults to True. Exception: If the payload is not a dictionary.

Task.description: A task is a unit of work that can be sent to the execution engine.

get_trigger_task.description: Retrieve the task that triggered the current execution. Returns: Task: The task object that triggered this execution.

iter_tasks.description: Iterate through all pending tasks, handling pagination automatically. This function yields tasks in batches determined by BATCH_SIZE constant.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of filters to apply. Defaults to None. Task: Each pending task matching the criteria.

get_sent_tasks.description: Retrieve a list of tasks that have been sent.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of tasks to retrieve. Defaults to None which is interpreted as 100 if where is also None.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Number of tasks to skip. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: where
parameters.description: Dictionary of filters to apply. Defaults to None. List[Task]: List of sent tasks matching the criteria.
